Description: Pottery lamp in form of ship. Raised stern forms stub-handle; on its face, Sarapis enthroned, with long sceptre, and Cerberos at his right side. Deck area, containing filling-hole, broken away. The curving raised edges of the deck form columns in relief, on the capitals of which are representations of snakes, possibly Agathos Daimôn and Tyche. On each side of the ship the blade of a steering-oar is shown. Pointed oval base, defined by grooves. NEIKH impressed. Brown clay covered with a red-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Similar to 1878,1217.36 (BM 48559) but considerably smaller. The details are less clear but much the same.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1991)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (392)
Tran Tam Tinh 1983 / Sérapis debout : corpus des monuments de Sérapis debout et étude iconographique (fig.268)
